conclusion: Analyze forces acting on balls to derive mass ratio of A to C.
Smooth hemispherical bowl with balls A, B, C connected by wires; angle θ = 30°.
Net force on each ball must be zero since the system is at rest.
For ball B, force from wire is balanced by normal force; tension equals weight of ball B.
For balls A and C, forces include tension from wires and weights.
Angle θ = 30° implies vertical component of tension for ball B.
Tension in wire for ball B equals weight of ball B; same magnitude for balls A and C.
Mass ratio of A to C determined by comparing vertical components of tension.
Vertical component of tension proportional to mass ratio.
Mass ratio of A to C is 4:1 based on angle θ = 30°.
